source: ドバイのような新しい都市や ローマのような古代都市に建つ ザハ ・ ハディッドの 国立21世紀美術館 そして ここ ニューヨークは ハイラインの開発によって 大いに影響を受けました
references: ['I think of new cities like Dubai or ancient cities like Rome with Zaha Hadid 's incredible MAXXI museum , or like right here in New York with the High Line , a city which has been so much influenced by the development of this .']
hypothesis: New cities like Dubai, ancient cities like Rome, Zaha Hadid's National Museum of the 21st Century, and here in New York, have been greatly impacted by the development of the High Line.

source: 窓やドアの向こうから 幼い子供たちが こちらを覗き見ており マココは人で 溢れている一方で 実は 何より驚くのが 全ての建物が子供で 溢れていることです
references: ['Behind every window and door frame , you 'll see a small child peering back at you , and while Makoko seems to be packed with people , what 's more shocking is actually the amount of children pouring out of every building .']
hypothesis: Small children are peering out of the windows and doors, and while Makoko is teeming with people, the most surprising thing is that the entire building is teeming with children.

source: 長年の間 ザバリーンの人々は 仮設の村に住み 地方行政を避けるため 遊牧民のような生活をしてきました しかし 1980年代初頭に カイロの東の辺境に位置する モカタム岩に定住しました
references: ['For years , the Zabbaleen would live in makeshift villages where they would move around trying to avoid the local authorities , but in the early 1980s , they settled on the Mokattam rocks just at the eastern edge of the city .']
hypothesis: For many years, the people of Zabaleen lived in makeshift villages, living a nomadic lifestyle to avoid local administration, but in the early 1980s they settled on Mocatum Rock, on Cairo's eastern frontier.

source: 今日紹介した これらの場所を見ると 実は 「 普通 」 などないということに 感銘を受けます そして 人はどのような環境にも 適応できることを 証明しています
references: ['In all these places I 've talked about today , what I do find fascinating is that there 's really no such thing as normal , and it proves that people are able to adapt to any kind of situation .']
hypothesis: When I look at these places I've shown you today, I'm really struck by the fact that there's no such thing as "normal," and they prove that humans can adapt to any environment.

source: ラビン元首相は オスロ ･ プロセスに関わった際 「 和平は友と結ぶのではない 和平とは 敵と結ぶものだ 」 と言いました 困難ですが 必要なことなのです
references: ['Prime Minister Rabin said when he engaged the Oslo process , " " You don 't make peace with your friends , you make peace with your enemies . " " It 's hard , but it is necessary .']
hypothesis: Former Prime Minister Rabin, when he was involved in the Oslo Process, said, "Peace is not made with friends, peace is made with enemies." It is difficult but necessary.

source: それから 60年を経た今 人々は街を 当初設計された目的とは 全く別の方向で使用しています 例えば この人たちは 集会所の窓を 椅子代わりにしています
references: ['Now 60 years later , the city has been taken over by people in very different ways from whatever perhaps intended for , like here , where you have the people sitting in the windows of the assembly hall .']
hypothesis: Now, 60 years later, people are using the city in completely different ways than it was originally designed for.

source: ある日突然 NGOは街頭でスローガンを叫ぶだけでなく 交渉の場に参加するようになりました 彼らがこうした武器の犠牲者を 代表していたことが理由の一つです
references: ['All of a sudden , NGOs were not only standing in the streets , crying their slogans , but they were taking [ them ] into the negotiations , partly because they represented the victims of these weapons .']
hypothesis: Suddenly one day, NGOs were not just shouting slogans in the streets, they were participating in the negotiations, in part because they represented the victims of these weapons.

source: キャリアを通じて 私は幸運にも 世界中のすぐれた建築家の キャリアを通じて 私は幸運にも 世界中のすぐれた建築家の 仕事を記録し 彼らの仕事がどのように 都市に影響を及ぼすか 観察することができました
references: ['Throughout my career , I 've been fortunate enough to work with many of the great international architects , documenting their work and observing how their designs have the capacity to influence the cities in which they sit .']
hypothesis: Throughout my career, I have been fortunate to document the work of some of the world's greatest architects and to observe how their work affects cities. was made

source: もし我々がこうした集団に対して 民主主義に移行して 国家間の正常で文明化された関係の 一端を担うようになれば 利益があるのだと 示すことができなければ どうなるでしょう ？
references: ['And if we cannot demonstrate to these groups that if you move towards democracy , if you move towards taking part in civilized and normal standards among states , there are some rewards on the other side .']
hypothesis: What if we can't show these groups that there are benefits to moving to democracy and becoming part of normal, civilized relations between nations?

source: 最後に 私の友人であり インスピレーションの源である ジータ ・ コブという ニューファンドランドの フォーゴ島を拠点にする ショアファスト基金の 創設者の言葉を引用したいと思います
references: ['I would like to end with a quote from a friend of mine and a source of inspiration , Zita Cobb , the founder of the wonderful Shorefast Foundation , based out of Fogo Island , Newfoundland .']
hypothesis: Finally, I would like to quote my friend and inspiration, Zita Cobb, the founder of the Shorefast Foundation, which is based on Fogo Island, Newfoundland.

source: 初めてインドに行った時訪れた家は 土間で水道もなければ 電気もない状態でした それでもこれが世界中で見られる実際の光景なのです
references: ['My first trip in India , I was in a person 's home where they had dirt floors , no running water , no electricity , and that 's really what I see all over the world .']
hypothesis: The first time I went to India, the house I visited was dirt floor, no running water, no electricity.

source: 外交における正当性とは何でしょう ？ 地域において広域の力を持つ 我々があいまいに集団と呼んでいる 彼らのことを理解し 外交に反映することができないならば 我々外交官が生み出す 問題解決の正当性は何でしょう ？
references: ['What is the legitimacy of diplomacy , of the the solution we devise as diplomats if they cannot be reflected and understood by also these broader forces of societies that we now very loosely call groups ?']
hypothesis: What is legitimacy in diplomacy? What is the legitimacy of the problem-solving that we diplomats produce if we cannot understand and reflect in our diplomacy what we vaguely call groups with wide-area powers in the region?

source: 私たちが行なっている 公共スペースのプロジェクトでは すべて地元の企業や商人団体と 緊密に働きます すべて地元の企業や商人団体と 緊密に働きます スペースを維持したり 街路の家具を移動したり 植物の世話をしてくれる人々です
references: ['With all of our projects , our public space projects , we work closely with local businesses and local merchant groups who maintain the spaces , move the furniture , take care of the plants .']
hypothesis: All of the public space projects that we do work closely with local businesses and trade associations. people who do

source: 1968年を救った写真だと 多くの人が言う有名な写真です 緊迫した年だった1968年は パリの五月革命が起き ベトナム戦争の真っ最中でした
references: ['A famous picture ; many people have said that it 's the picture that saved 1968 , which was a turbulent year — the student riots in Paris , the height of the Vietnam War .']
hypothesis: It's a famous photo that many say saved 1968. It was a tense year, with the May Revolution in Paris and the height of the Vietnam War.

source: 我々が もし民主主義を説く一方で 彼らを代表する集団と 交渉しないのであれば ダブルスタンダードと言われても当然です
references: ['How can we escape [ having ] a double-standard , if we at the same time preach democracy and at the same time don 't want to deal with the groups that are representative ?']
hypothesis: If we preach democracy but don't negotiate with the groups that represent them, then it's fair to say we have a double standard.

source: また 数年間にわたって 北京に建てられた レム ・ コールハースの 中国中央電視台本部ビルや ヘルツォーク ＆ ド ・ ムーロンの オリンピックスタジアムの 建設現場を追いました
references: ['But over the course of several years , I 've been documenting Rem Koolhaas 's CCTV building in Beijing and the olympic stadium in the same city by the architects Herzog and de Meuron .']
hypothesis: Over the years, I followed the construction sites of Rem Koolhaas's China Central Television Headquarters and Herzog & de Meuron's Olympic Stadium in Beijing.

source: 人々や市民団体を 問題の一部としてではなく 解決策の一部として 取り込むことができなければ 交渉によって気候変動問題を 解決することはできないでしょう
references: ['How are we going to solve climate change through negotiations , unless we are able to make civil society and people , not part of the problem , but part of the solution ?']
hypothesis: If we can't get people and civil society to be part of the solution, not part of the problem, then negotiations will not solve the climate change problem.

source: 建設期間が何年にもわたると 雑然としていながらも 街としての機能を備えた 労働者の集落ができます 彼らが建築している洗練された建物とは 対照的です
references: ['As the length of the construction takes years , workers end up forming a rather rough-and-ready informal city , making for quite a juxtaposition against the sophisticated structures that they 're building .']
hypothesis: Over the years of construction, you'll end up with cluttered yet functioning workers' settlements, in contrast to the sophisticated buildings they're building.

source: 彼らは与えられた環境の中で 自分たちのスペースをなるべく 綺麗で居心地よくしようとします
references: ['They typically make the best out of their conditions , and try to make their spaces look nice and homey , or at least up until as far as they can reach .']
hypothesis: They try to make their space as clean and comfortable as possible in the environment they are given.

source: 住人たちがそれぞれ 独自の適応方法を見出すことで 住人たちがそれぞれ 独自の適応方法を見出すことで このタワーはミクロ経済と 中小ビジネスが活発な このタワーはミクロ経済と 中小ビジネスが活発な 生きた街のようになるのです
references: ['And with each inhabitant finding their own unique way of coming by , this tower becomes like a living city , a place which is alive with micro-economies and small businesses .']
hypothesis: By each resident finding their own way of adapting By each resident finding their own way of adapting This tower is a lively city with active microeconomy and small and medium businesses it becomes

source: タワーに新しく越してくる人は 屋根はすでにあるので 住みたい場所を カーテンや敷物で区切ります
references: ['When a new inhabitant moves into the tower , they already have a roof over their head , so they just typically mark their space with a few curtains or sheets .']
hypothesis: Newcomers to the tower already have a roof, so they divide the area they want to live in with curtains and rugs.

source: 私がマココを訪れた そもそもの理由は 友人のクンレ ・ アデイェミが マココの子供たちのために 立ち上げた 三階建ての水上校舎を作る プロジェクトに参加するためでした
references: ['What originally brought me to Makoko was this project from a friend of mine , Kunlé Adeyemi , who recently finished building this three-story floating school for the kids in Makoko .']
hypothesis: The reason I came to Makoko in the first place was to participate in a project that my friend Kunle Adeyemi had set up for Makoko's children to build a three-story floating school building.

source: このような集まりは 興味深い対比を浮き彫りにします このような集まりは 興味深い対比を浮き彫りにします 新品が飾られている一方で 新居の調度品を展示するための 小道具として ゴミが混在しているのです
references: ['A gathering like this one offers such a juxtaposition where all the new stuff is displayed and all the garbage is used as props to display all their new home accessories .']
hypothesis: Gatherings like this highlight an interesting contrast: Gatherings like this highlight an interesting contrast: new items are on display, while trash is mixed in as props to showcase the furnishings of the new home.

source: 対人地雷禁止条約および クラスター爆弾禁止条約は 市民団体を関与させるという 従来の外交政策からの転換がなければ なしえなかったことでしょう
references: ['We could never have done the convention against anti-personnel landmines and the convention that is banning cluster munitions unless we had done diplomacy differently , by engaging with civil society .']
hypothesis: The anti-personnel mine ban treaty and the cluster munition ban treaty would not have been possible without a shift from traditional foreign policy to involve civil society.

source: この住人たちは文字通り 自らの手で家を建てます そして この愛情に満ちた努力が このタワーに住む 多くの家族の誇りになるのです
references: ['The inhabitants literally built up these homes with their own hands , and this labor of love instills a great sense of pride in many families living in this tower .']
hypothesis: These residents literally build their homes with their own hands, and it's this loving effort that makes the tower's many families proud.

source: 30階にはジムがあり 重りやバーベルには 備え付けられることのなかった エレベーターの滑車を使っています
references: ['And on the 30th floor , there is a gym where all the weights and barbells are made out of the leftover pulleys from the elevators which were never installed .']
hypothesis: There's a gym on the 30th floor that uses lift pulleys that were never installed for weights and barbells.

source: しかし この牛小屋の向かいにある 部屋には新婚の夫婦が 住んでおり 地元の人曰く この地域で最も 素敵なアパートらしいです
references: ['But then in the apartment across the hall from this cow shed lives a newly married couple in what locals describe as one of the nicest apartments in the area .']
hypothesis: But the apartment across from this cowshed is occupied by a newlywed couple in what locals say is the nicest apartment in the area.

source: コミュニケーションのスキルを 向上させなければ より大きな 「 私たち 」 を作って 我々の問題に対処することはできないのです
references: ['How are we going to settle and build a bigger " " We " " to deal with our issues if we don 't improve our skills of communication ?']
hypothesis: Unless we improve our communication skills, we can't create a larger "us" to deal with our problems.

source: タワーの中では 色々なサービスを 目にします たとえば理髪店や 小さな工房 そして各階に 小さな食料品店や店があります
references: ['Throughout the tower , you come across all kinds of services , like the barber , small factories , and every floor has a little grocery store or shop .']
hypothesis: Inside the tower, you'll find a variety of services, like barbershops, small workshops, and small grocery stores and shops on each floor.

source: ゲイツ財団の仕事で 私が一番好きなのは 発展途上国を訪れることができることで 実際かなり頻繁に行っています
references: ['One of my favorite parts of my job at the Gates Foundation is that I get to travel to the developing world , and I do that quite regularly .']
hypothesis: My favorite thing about my work at the Gates Foundation is that it allows me to visit developing countries, and I actually do it quite often.

source: 私達が子供に願うことは同じなのです 子供達が大きくなって成功し 健康で幸せな人生を送って欲しいのです
references: ['They want what we want for our children and that is for their children to grow up successful , to be healthy , and to have a successful life .']
hypothesis: We want our children to be the same: we want them to grow up to be successful, to live healthy, happy lives.

source: このようなことはエチオピアのような国では 大きなインパクトがあるのです このおかげでエチオピアの子供の死亡率が 2000年から2008年にかけて 25 % 低下しました
references: ['That is having real impact in a country like Ethiopia , and it 's why you see their child mortality numbers coming down 25 percent from 2000 to 2008 .']
hypothesis: This kind of thing has a big impact in a country like Ethiopia, and it's helped Ethiopia's child mortality rate drop by 25 percent from 2000 to 2008.

source: しかも何が人々を幸せにするか想像するのでなく 例えばラテンアメリカなどに出かけて行って そこでは幸せが家族との生活に関係していると 理解した上で行なっています
references: ['And they don 't just guess what makes people happy ; they go to places like Latin America and they realize that happiness there is associated with family life .']
hypothesis: And instead of imagining what makes people happy, they go to, say, Latin America, and do it with the understanding that happiness has to do with family life.

source: 10億人以上の人々が暮らしています でも麻痺症の報告をする 地域の医師が3万5000人いて 臨床医や薬局からの大規模な報告システムがあります
references: ['They have over a billion people in this country , but they have 35,000 local doctors who report paralysis , and clinicians , a huge reporting system in chemists .']
hypothesis: It's home to over a billion people, but there are 35,000 local doctors who report paralysis, and we have an extensive reporting system from clinicians and pharmacies.

source: 重要なことは これが我々が おそらく初めて目にする アラブ世界の歴史上初の ボトムアップの革命であり 民衆主体の革命だということです
references: ['The point is that we are probably seeing , for the first time in the history of the Arab world , a revolution bottom-up — people 's revolution .']
hypothesis: The important thing is that this is probably the first time we've seen this, the first bottom-up revolution in the history of the Arab world, the first democratic revolution.

source: 将来 私たちは 人々や市民団体から断絶した 外交政策ではなく こうした成功例を参考にする必要があります
references: ['In the future , I believe , we should draw examples from these different illustrations , not to have diplomacy which is disconnected from people and civil society .']
hypothesis: In the future, we need to draw on these successes, not foreign policies that are disconnected from people and civil society.

source: 地元の建築家や シンクタンクの方から トーレ ・ デ ・ ダビの話を聞きました カラカスの中心に位置する 45階建てのオフィスビルです
references: ['During a conversation with local architects Urban-Think Tank , I learned about the Torre David , a 45-story office building which sits right in the center of Caracas .']
hypothesis: Local architects and think tanks told me about the Torre de Davi, a 45-story office building in the heart of Caracas.

source: さて アフリカはナイジェリアの マココというコミュニティーに 話を移しましょう ラゴス ・ ラグーンの水上で 15万人の人々が 生活をしているスラムです
references: ['Let 's go now to Africa , to Nigeria , to a community called Makoko , a slum where 150,000 people live just meters above the Lagos Lagoon .']
hypothesis: Now let's turn Africa into a community called Makoko in Nigeria, a slum where 150,000 people live above the water in the Lagos Lagoon.

source: これらの特殊な空間に 暮らし 働き 遊ぶ人々によって 作られているため こうした地域はその環境を 十分生かすように 直感的に設計されています
references: ['Created by these very people who live , work and play in these particular spaces , these neighborhoods are intuitively designed to make the most of their circumstances .']
hypothesis: Created by people who live, work and play in these special spaces, these neighborhoods are intuitively designed to take full advantage of their environment.

source: 彼女はこう言いました 「 均一性という病が ― 生きる喜びを奪っている 」 まさにその通りだと思います
references: ['She says that " " there 's this plague of sameness which is killing the human joy , " " and I couldn 't agree with her more .']
hypothesis: She said, "The disease of uniformity is robbing us of the joy of living."

source: （ 拍手 ） そして機械的機構がなくなる代わりに 電線が使われると言います
references: ['( Applause ) They then pointed out that there 'd be , sort of , the other controls by wire , to get rid of all that mechanical stuff .']
hypothesis: (Applause) And they say that instead of getting rid of mechanical mechanisms, they're going to use wires.

source: この問題に関する情報はあまりにも多く 様々な形で 皆さんに提供できます
references: ['And maybe to put that in perspective : there 's so much data on this , I 'll be happy to give it to you in different forms .']
hypothesis: There's just too much information on this subject that I can give you in many different ways.

source: そしてなにより 我々が 多数派の権利を尊重しないとしたら ムスリム同胞団に 少数派の権利を尊重すべきであるなどと どうして言うことができるでしょうか ？
references: ['And how can we tell the Muslim Brotherhood , as we should , that they must respect minority rights , if we don 't accept majority rights ?']
hypothesis: And above all, if we don't respect the rights of the majority, how can we tell the Muslim Brotherhood that we should respect the rights of minorities?

source: ８年ほど前から この廃墟ビルに 人々が移り住み始め ― この作りかけのビルの 支柱の間に 家を作り始めたのです
references: ['About eight years ago , people started moving into the abandoned tower and began to build their homes right in between every column of this unfinished tower .']
hypothesis: About eight years ago, people started moving into this abandoned building, building their homes between the stilts of this half-finished building.

source: この未完成のタワーで 生活していく上で 出てくる諸問題に対して 住人たちは様々な解決策を 編み出しました
references: ['Within the tower , people have come up with all sorts of solutions in response to the various needs which arise from living in an unfinished tower .']
hypothesis: Residents have come up with various solutions to the challenges of living in this unfinished tower.

source: でもコカコーラはあることに気づきました 現地の人々が商品をまとめ買いして コカコーラの手が届かない地域で売っていることです
references: ['But Coke noticed something — they noticed that local people were taking the product , buying it in bulk and then reselling it in these hard-to-reach places .']
hypothesis: But Coca-Cola realized that there were local people buying the product in bulk and selling it in areas that Coca-Cola couldn't reach.

source: 医者は8月14日と15日に便サンプルを採取し 8月25日には 1型ポリオであると確認されました
references: ['On August 14th and 15th , they took a stool sample , and by the 25th of August , it was confirmed he had Type 1 polio .']
hypothesis: Doctors took stool samples on August 14th and 15th, and on August 25th, he was confirmed to have type 1 polio.

source: そして20世紀には革命がありました この革命は20世紀の初めに起こり まだ続いています
references: ['Now , in the 20th century we had a revolution that was initiated at the beginning of the 20th century , and which is still going on .']
hypothesis: And in the 20th century there was a revolution, this revolution happened at the beginning of the 20th century and is still going on.

source: 同時に 私たち物理学者は 量子論や相対性理論を理解し 組み合わせ 発展させるのに 時間を費やしてきました
references: ['At the same time , we physicists have been busy trying to make sense of and build on and integrate the discoveries of quantum theory and relativity .']
hypothesis: At the same time, we physicists have spent time understanding, combining, and developing quantum theory and relativity.

source: これはブルックリンのベッド ・ スタイ 短い道があったことが分かります 車のためで あまり必要ではありませんでした
references: ['This is in Bed-Stuy , Brooklyn , and you can see the short leg that was there , used for cars , that 's not really needed .']
hypothesis: This is Bed-Stuy in Brooklyn. You can see there was a short road for the car, and it wasn't really needed.

source: 私たちは この方法を バスにも適用していて ニューヨーク市の バス車両台数は 北米最大ですが 速度は一番遅いです
references: ['We 've also brought this approach to our buses , and New York City has the largest bus fleet in North America , the slowest bus speeds .']
hypothesis: We've applied this method to buses, and New York City has the largest fleet of buses in North America, but the slowest.

source: 画面では表面しか見えませんが 氷は おそらく何百kmもの厚さがあります
references: ['So what you 're looking at is the surface of the moon Europa , which is a thick sheet of ice , probably a hundred kilometers thick .']
hypothesis: You can only see the surface on your screen, but the ice is probably hundreds of kilometers thick.

source: 今夜は私が今一番夢中な エンターテインメントとロボティクスが交わる所について お話ししたいと思います
references: ['So tonight I 'd like to tell you about the intersection that I 'm most excited about at this very moment , which is entertainment and robotics .']
hypothesis: Tonight, I want to talk to you about one of my biggest passions right now: the intersection of entertainment and robotics.

source: 柔らかく多孔性の 黄土高原の 土で有名なこの地域では ごく最近まで約４千万人が 地中の家に住んでいました
references: ['In a region famous for the soft , porous Loess Plateau soil , there lived until recently an estimated 40 million people in these houses underground .']
hypothesis: In this region, famous for its soft, porous Loess Plateau soil, until very recently about 40 million people lived in underground homes.

source: トーレ ・ デ ・ ダビのような場所が 特に注目に値するのは このような骨組みだけの構造物が 人々が創造力を発揮する 基礎を提供するからです
references: ['What makes places like the Torre David particularly remarkable is this sort of skeleton framework where people can have a foundation where they can tap into .']
hypothesis: Places like the Torre de Davi are particularly noteworthy because these skeletal structures provide a foundation for people to be creative.

source: そしてそのような多くの辺境の地で その土地の母親達と交流すると 私達の持つ共通点に とても驚かされます

hypothesis: And when you interact with local mothers in many of these remote places, it's amazing what we have in common.

source: まず村の屋外で排便することが よくないという理由を説明し 理解してもらいます

hypothesis: First, explain why it's not a good idea to defecate outdoors in the village, and get them to understand.

source: つまり 人々が医療と開発援助で 何を実際に求めているか 理解し始めれば コミュニティに変化をもたらし 国全体に変化をもたらすことができるのです
references: ['So if we can start to understand what people really want in health and development , we can change communities and we can change whole nations .']
hypothesis: So when we start to understand what people really want in health care and development assistance, we can make a difference in our communities, and we can make a difference across our nations.

source: 国境を越えてすぐ北にあるネパールか すぐ南にあるジャールカンド州です

hypothesis: Nepal, just across the border, or Jharkhand, just south.

hypothesis: Compare the time it takes to cross the continent in a horse-drawn wagon to the time it takes to travel by train or by plane.

source: 一方の時間と空間に対する考え方と もう片方の社会に対する 考え方は密接に関係していました

hypothesis: The idea of time and space on the one hand and the idea of society on the other were closely related.

hypothesis: And if we take it even further, it would be natural to think that in a correlative universe all properties are related to each other.

source: 街路とは 都市のもっとも大切な 資産の１つですが その ほとんどが ― 日常の風景に隠れています

hypothesis: Streets are one of the city's most valuable assets, but most of them are hidden in the everyday landscape.

hypothesis: The money spent on science is on the left, in the purple and yellow circles, in the

source: 赤十字国際委員会 ICRCは 中立の立場を取っているため 誰とでも対話をしています

hypothesis: The International Committee of the Red Cross, the ICRC, is neutral, so we talk to everyone.

source: 人々はメインデッキから 長い木のカヌーに乗り 自分の家やお店のある 広大な地域を移動します

source: 特にマココのような地域での ナイジェリアの人口増加は 特にマココのような地域での ナイジェリアの人口増加は 物事が手に負えない状態に なってきていることを象徴しています

hypothesis: Nigeria's population growth, especially in areas like Makoko, Nigeria's population growth, especially in areas like Makoko, symbolizes that things are getting out of hand.

references: ['I feel that , if we can understand what makes something like Coca-Cola ubiquitous , we can apply those lessons then for the public good .']
hypothesis: EnglishIf we can understand what makes something like Coca-Cola popular, we can apply it to benefit society.

source: これらの小規模起業家たちが コカコーラを売って収益を得ることができるのは 屋台や荷車に積んだ瓶を1本残らず売っているからです
references: ['Now the reason these micro-entrepreneurs can sell or make a profit is they have to sell every single bottle in their pushcart or their wheelbarrow .']
hypothesis: The reason these small entrepreneurs are able to sell Coca-Cola and make money is because they're selling every single bottle in the stalls and carts.

source: そのキャンペーン用にコカコーラが制作したこの曲を聴いてみましょう ソマリのヒップホップ ・ アーチストによる 「 ウェイヴィン フラッグ 」
references: ['Let 's listen to this song that Coke created for it , " " Wavin ' Flag " " by a Somali hip hop artist .']

source: しかし 都市のなかで ４ブロックほど移動したいとき 車は楽しくも 、 効率的でも 、 生産的でもありません
references: ['The problem is , you get into the city and you want to go four blocks , it 's neither fun nor efficient nor productive .']
hypothesis: But when you want to move four blocks in a city, cars aren't fun, they're not efficient, they're not productive.

source: それはすなわち 200ワットの電力と 700から800ワットの熱を 手にいれることになります
references: ['It doesn 't matter much — it says if you get 200 watts of electricity , you 'll get 700 or 800 watts of heat .']
hypothesis: That's about 200 watts of power and 700 to 800 watts of heat.

source: その一方で 我われは コミュニティとして 不完全な証拠から 皆が同意する結論を なんとか導き出します
references: ['On the other hand , somehow we manage to reason together as a community , from incomplete evidence to conclusions that we all agree about .']
hypothesis: On the other hand, as a community, we manage to draw conclusions that we all agree on from incomplete evidence.

source: そして この事実を共有して 結論を導き出す プロセスとコミュニティに 参加することは 民主主義に関して色々と 教えてくれると思います

hypothesis: And I think that participating in this process of sharing facts and drawing conclusions and being part of a community can teach us a lot about democracy.

source: そして現在 明らかにしようとしているのは 宇宙は関係により 成り立っているというアイデアです
references: ['And what we ’ ve been working out is the implications , really , of the idea that the universe is made up of relations .']
hypothesis: And what we're trying to reveal now is the idea that the universe is made up of relationships.

source: 過去の試みは どれも効果が無いと分かり 私たちは 別の もっと大きなアプローチで 街路について考えました

hypothesis: None of our past attempts proved to be effective, so we started thinking about the streets in a different, much larger approach.

source: 何かに着手する際の 長年を要する研究調査や 何かに着手する際の 長年を要する研究調査や コンピューターモデルを 待っているのではなく 塗料と仮設のもので 遂行したのです

source: 私たちは この即効性の高いアプローチを 自転車プログラムにも適用しました ６年間で自転車は ニューヨークにおける 日常の移動手段の１つになりました

hypothesis: We applied this fast-acting approach to our cycling program, and in six years, cycling has become a part of everyday transportation in New York City.

source: その何がすごいのかと言うと 地球では液体の水が ある場所ならばどこでも 生命が宿っています

hypothesis: And what's amazing about it is that on Earth, wherever there's liquid water, there's life.

hypothesis: Part of that galaxy that contains billions of suns and shines like it's the center of the galaxy.

hypothesis: Even if you dodge me, there's a guy with a spoon waiting for you later."

hypothesis: He used dialogue as a political process not as a strategy for the weak, but as a strategy for the strong.

hypothesis: He solved some very difficult problems and actively engaged in dialogue through the truth and reconciliation process where people came together to talk.

hypothesis: 1.5 million children die each year from diarrhea, mostly from open defecation.

hypothesis: He came back and said, "You finally made me what I wanted."

references: ['Dialogue is not easy — not between individuals , not between groups , not between governments — but it is very necessary .']
hypothesis: Dialogue is not easy, neither between individuals, groups, or governments, but dialogue is absolutely necessary.

source: 自分の個人的な体験から 時には ただ席を立つほうが 容易な場合があることはわかっています また 時には争う必要もあるでしょう
references: ['We know from our personal experiences that it 's easy sometimes just to walk , and sometimes you may need to fight .']
hypothesis: I know from personal experience that sometimes it's easier just to get out of your seat, and sometimes you have to fight.

source: 住人たちは 力を合わせて 共同のスペースを作り 未完成のビルではなく 居心地の良い家に なるよう工夫しています
references: ['Together , the inhabitants created public spaces and designed them to feel more like a home and less like an unfinished tower .']
hypothesis: Residents work together to create communal spaces that are designed to be cozy homes, not unfinished buildings.

source: 水上に出れば 彼らの生活が この特別な生活様式に 完全に順応している とわかります
references: ['When out on the water , it 's clear that life has been completely adapted to this very specific way of living .']
hypothesis: Once you're out on the water, you'll find that their lives are perfectly adapted to this particular way of life.

source: マココやトーレ ・ デ ・ ダビのように ザバリーンにも 典型的な町にある 施設は全て揃っています
references: ['Like Makoko and the Torre David , throughout the Zabbaleen you 'll find all the same facilities as in any typical neighborhood .']
hypothesis: Like Makoko and Torre de Davi, Zabaleen has all the facilities of a typical town.

source: コカコーラの実績が重要なのは これを分析して学ぶことができれば 人々の命を救うことができるからです
references: ['Coke 's success is relevant , because if we can analyze it , learn from it , then we can save lives .']
hypothesis: Coca-Cola's track record is important because if we can analyze it and learn from it, we can save lives.

source: 市場分析の部署があるような体制です 他の消費財メーカーと同じような感じです
references: ['They have a whole team called " " Knowledge and Insight . " " It 's a lot like other consumer companies .']
hypothesis: It's like having a market analysis department, just like any other consumer goods manufacturer.

source: 医療従業者の比率は たったの5年で 3万人に1人から 2500人に1人となったのです
references: ['In just five years , their ratio went from one worker for every 30,000 people to one worker for every 2,500 people .']
hypothesis: In just five years, the health worker ratio went from 1 in 30,000 to 1 in 2,500.

source: そしてそれができたら 世界中全ての国で全員に施す ポリオの予防接種を止められます
references: ['And if we could do that , we could stop vaccinating everybody , worldwide , in all of our countries for polio .']
hypothesis: And if we can do that, we can stop immunizing everyone against polio in every country in the world.

source: しかし これの着想の中心は 交通問題に対する 新しい解決策だと思います
references: ['The big idea here is , I think , a new piece of a solution to a fairly big problem in transportation .']
hypothesis: But I think the heart of this idea is a new solution to the transportation problem.

source: 誰がどんなことに感銘を覚えるかは 分かりませんが 皆 自動車は世界を変えたと 信じていると思います
references: ['You never know what strikes the fancy of whom , but everybody is perfectly willing to believe the car changed the world .']
hypothesis: I don't know who will be impressed by what, but I think everyone believes that cars have changed the world.

source: 人々は 個人差はありますが 90から95 % のエネルギーを 歩いての移動に費やしています
references: ['And people spend , depending on who they are , between 90 and 95 percent of their energy getting around on foot .']
hypothesis: People spend between 90 and 95 percent of their energy walking, depending on the individual.

source: これが受け入れられる かもしれないと感じた 最も嬉しい出来事は ここカリフォルニアで起きました
references: ['One of the more exciting things that occurred to us about why it might get accepted , happened out here in California .']
hypothesis: The happiest thing that made me feel like this might be accepted happened here in California.

source: 我々が何に資源を注ぎ込むかを この星の ― エネルギー利用を 変えることができます それも もっと面白くできます
references: ['We could change the way people allocate their resources , the way this planet uses its energy , make it more fun .']
hypothesis: We can change the planet's energy use, what we put our resources into, and we can make it more interesting.

source: （ 笑 ） あなたはそれらがどのようにして 作られたか 興味を持つはずです 人間ですから
references: ['( Laughter ) Then you want to know , you ’ re a person , you want to know how is it made .']
hypothesis: (Laughter) You should be interested in how they're made, because you're human.

source: なぜならアリストテレスやニュートンの 宇宙論のように宇宙の外の 創造主を組み込む余地がないからです
references: ['Because there ’ s no place to put a maker outside , as there was in the Aristotelian and the Newtonian universe .']
hypothesis: Because there's no room for a creator outside the universe like Aristotle's or Newton's cosmology.

source: ダーウィンは私たちが 見ているもの全てを説明するのに 十分な自己形成のプロセスを 提示してくれましたから
references: ['Now , Darwin taught us that there are processes of self-organization that suffice to explain all of us and everything we see .']
hypothesis: Darwin gave us enough of a process of self-formation to explain everything we see.

source: ダーウィンの考えは アリストテレスの宇宙論だけでなく ニュートンの宇宙論でも納得の行く 説明はできません
references: ['Darwin wouldn ’ t make sense in an Aristotelian universe , and wouldn ’ t really make sense in a Newtonian universe .']
hypothesis: Darwin's ideas cannot be satisfactorily explained not only by Aristotle's cosmology, but also by Newton's cosmology.

source: ですから バランスを変えようと 努力しました 私たちの新しいアプローチの 良い例は タイムズ ・ スクエアです
references: ['So we worked hard to change that balance , and probably the best example of our new approach is in Times Square .']
hypothesis: So we tried to change the balance. A good example of our new approach is Times Square.

source: １日に35万人が タイムズ ・ スクエアを 通過します 改善の努力はされてきました
references: ['Three hundred and fifty thousand people a day walk through Times Square , and people had tried for years to make changes .']
hypothesis: 350,000 people pass through Times Square every day, and efforts have been made to improve it.

source: こちらの小さな青い鍵で この街の最新の交通手段を 自由に使うことが出来るのです
references: ['And so with this little blue key , you can unlock the keys to the city and this brand new transportation option .']
hypothesis: This little blue key gives you access to the city's newest form of transportation.

source: それがどんなに不合理なことなのか 15分間で皆さんを 説得したいと思います
references: ['So I want to try and convince you in about 15 minutes that that 's a ridiculous and ludicrous thing to do .']
hypothesis: I want to convince you in 15 minutes how absurd that is.

source: 左に見える白くて 大きな球体は土星です 実は写真の背景が土星で
references: ['So that big sweeping , white sphere in the corner is Saturn , which is actually in the background of the picture .']
hypothesis: The big white sphere on the left is Saturn.

source: ドキュメンタリー番組では このように描かれています 美しいイメージです
references: ['This is how we visualize that in " " Wonders of the Solar System . " " It 's a beautiful graphic .']
hypothesis: The documentary portrays it like this, it's a beautiful image.

source: また あまり触れられていませんが アポロ計画による宇宙探査は 経済に大きく貢献しました
references: ['What 's also not often said about the space exploration , about the Apollo program , is the economic contribution it made .']
hypothesis: Also, although it's not often mentioned, the space exploration of the Apollo program made a huge contribution to the economy.

source: 皆さんもご存知の通り ごく最近まで 実際に油を回収するという対応は ほとんどありませんでした
references: ['And as you know , there 's been a very weak response , up until recently , to actually collect the oil .']
hypothesis: As many of you know, until very recently, very little has actually been done to recover the oil.

source: ブー ヒュワディーンと トーマス ドルビーです お招きいただいて ありがとうございました ここで歌えるのは光栄です
references: ['Boo Hewerdine , Thomas Dolby , thank you very much for inviting me . It 's been a blessing singing for you .']
hypothesis: Boo Huwadine and Thomas Dolby. Thank you for inviting me. It's an honor to sing here.

source: 緊張が高まった時には 彼らはすでに対話を行っており それが 様々な問題を対処する上での 力となるのです
references: ['And when tension increased , they already had that dialogue , and that was a strength to deal with different issues .']
hypothesis: When tensions rise, they already have a dialogue that can help them deal with a variety of issues.

source: そして徐々に 拾いものを使って 壁が作られ ありあわせのもので出来た スペースが出来上がります
references: ['Slowly , from found materials , walls rise , and people create a space out of any found objects or materials .']
hypothesis: And then, gradually, walls are built from what's found, creating a space made from what's on hand.

source: カヌーが雑貨店となって 女性たちが家から家へと 歯みがき粉から果物まで 何でも売りまわっています
references: ['Even the canoes become variety stores where ladies paddle from house to house , selling anything from toothpaste to fresh fruits .']
hypothesis: Canoes have become grocery stores, and women go from house to house selling everything from toothpaste to fruit.

source: 彼らは運河の中を 発電機を乗せた 大きなカヌーで移動しながら コミュニティーの人々を 楽しませていました
references: ['They were floating through the canals in a large canoe with a fitted-out generator for all of the community to enjoy .']
hypothesis: They entertained the community as they traveled through the canals in large canoes with generators.

source: 「 どうやってコミュニティの医療従業者に自分のアイデアを出してもらうか ？ 」 という 話し合いを始めています
references: ['They 're starting to talk about , " " How do you have the health community workers generate their own ideas ?']
hypothesis: We're starting a conversation about how to get community health workers to come up with their ideas.

source: インドの北部のビハール州に住む シュリランという 18ヶ月の男の子の話をします
references: ['Let me tell you the story of Shriram , an 18 month boy in Bihar , a northern state in India .']
hypothesis: I'm going to tell you the story of an 18-month-old boy named Sriran, who lives in the northern state of Bihar, India.

source: 今年の8月8日 シュリランは麻痺を訴え 13日に両親に連れられて医者に行きました
references: ['This year on August 8th , he felt paralysis and on the 13th , his parents took him to the doctor .']
hypothesis: On August 8th of this year, Sriran complained of paralysis and on the 13th he was taken to the doctor by his parents.

source: ポリオに関する課題の1つは依然としてマーケティングです でも皆さんが思うようなことではないかもしれません
references: ['Now one of the challenges in polio , still , is marketing , but it might not be what you think .']
hypothesis: One of the challenges with polio remains marketing, but it may not be what you think.

source: つまりこの目標を達成するのに 99 % のところまで来たのに 資金がなくなってしまうところなのです
references: ['So we are 99 percent of the way there on this goal and we 're about to run short of money .']
hypothesis: So we're 99 percent of the way to achieving this goal, and we're running out of money.

source: 中国単独でも ４億から６億人の人々が 今後15年で 都市に移動すると考えられます
references: ['China alone is going to move four to six hundred million people into cities in the next decade and a half .']
hypothesis: In China alone, 400 to 600 million people are expected to move to cities in the next 15 years.

source: 中国では1998年時点で 4億1700万人が自転車を使い 170万人が自動車を使っていました
references: ['If — in China , in the year 1998 , 417 million people used bicycles ; 1.7 million people used cars .']
hypothesis: In 1998, 417 million people in China used bicycles and 1.7 million people used cars.

source: 本当にこの技術に関しては 皆さんの好きなだけ話が出来ます
references: ['So , I 'm happy , really , I am happy to talk about this technology as much as you want .']
hypothesis: Really, you can talk as much as you want about this technology.

source: もしこれが徒歩よりたった３倍速ければ ― ３倍でいいのです ― 徒歩30分は10分になります
references: ['If this thing goes only three times as fast as walking — three times — a 30-minute walk becomes 10 minutes .']
hypothesis: If it's only three times faster than walking - three times better - then 30 minutes walking becomes 10 minutes.

source: もっと興味深いことは 熱力学の法則によって 20 ％ 以上の効率を 得ることはできませんが
references: ['But more interestingly , the thermodynamics of this say , you 're never going to get more than 20 percent efficiency .']
hypothesis: What's more interesting is that the laws of thermodynamics don't allow us to get more than 20 percent efficiency.

source: なので 自然選択をベースとした 生物学の理論は 生物学的なシステムの特性が 相関性を持つことが必要です
references: ['So a theory of biology based on natural selection requires a relational notion of what are the properties of biological systems .']
hypothesis: So theories of biology based on natural selection require that the properties of biological systems be correlated.

source: 徐々にですが 認知科学や 人間科学 経済学などの域に 浸透していっています
references: ['And slowly , that idea is leaking out to the cognitive sciences , the human sciences , economics , et cetera .']
hypothesis: Slowly, it's making its way into areas like cognitive science, human science, and economics.

source: 街路は素早く 安価で作り直せること すぐに利益が生まれて ― 人気スポットにもなり得ます
references: ['You can remake your streets quickly , inexpensively , it can provide immediate benefits , and it can be quite popular .']
hypothesis: Streets can be rebuilt quickly and cheaply, and they can quickly become profitable -- they can even become hotspots.

source: このプロジェクトでは 仮設であることが重要でした どんな機能をするか 見せることができるからです どんな機能をするか 見せることができるからです
references: ['And the temporary materials are an important part of the program , because we were able to show how it worked .']
hypothesis: It was important for this project to be temporary, because I could show it how it worked, so I could show it how it worked.

source: 実は これはロスで 私たちが道路に施した 緑色の水玉までも 真似していますね
references: ['This is actually in Los Angeles , and they actually copied even the green dots that we had on the streets .']
hypothesis: In fact, this is Ross, and it even mimics the green polka dots that we put on the road.

source: 多様性があり 若者 お年寄り 黒人 白人 女性 子供 全ての人々が利用しています
references: ['It 's diverse — young , old , black , white , women , kids , all getting on a bike .']
hypothesis: Diverse, young, old, black, white, women, children, all use it

source: 科学に充てられる費用はどれでしょう これは英国政府の支出額で
references: ['So this is a game called " " spot the science budgets . " " This is the U.K. government spend .']
hypothesis: What is the cost of science? This is the amount spent by the British government.

source: 周囲を回る 連星が存在します 大きなガスの星です
references: ['And it has a binary companion that goes around it , so a big star , a big ball of gas .']

references: ['The argument has always been made , and it will always be made , that we know enough about the universe .']

references: ['But then I thought , well , in case of a fire , I might be the last one to ignite .']
hypothesis: But I thought, if there was a fire, maybe I wouldn't burn to the end.

source: ポケットに手を入れてこう言います 「 皆さんなにか買いましょう 」
references: ['So , we put my hand in my pocket and say , " " Guys , let 's just buy stuff .']
hypothesis: I put my hand in my pocket and say, "Everyone, let's buy something."

source: 書物をあさり その数字の出典を探しましたが 書物をあさり その数字の出典を探しましたが 見つかりませんでした
references: ['I 've been digging through the literature for the original reference for that number , and I could never find it .']
hypothesis: I've scoured the books for the source of that number, and I've scoured the books for the source of the number, and I can't find it.

source: １時間８ドルから10ドル １日65ドルという価格にあります
references: ['It 's because they said , " " It 's eight to 10 dollars an hour and 65 dollars a day .']
hypothesis: It's priced at $8 to $10 an hour, $65 a day.

source: 走行車両の75パーセントは搭乗者が一人です ところが 通勤時は 12パーセントが相乗りです
references: ['Today , 75 percent of the trips are single-occupancy vehicles , yet 12 percent of trips to work are currently carpool .']
hypothesis: Seventy-five percent of the vehicles on the road are occupied alone, while 12 percent of commuters are carpools.

source: このように 価格は 意思決定を大きく左右し 結果 運転を控えるようになるのです
references: ['So again , we can see that price plays an enormous role in people 's willingness to reduce their driving behavior .']
hypothesis: In this way, price can play a big role in decision-making, and as a result, people tend to drive less.

source: 渋滞課金制度は 道路課金制度を支える技術と それに対する人々の心理を試すものです
references: ['And what congestion pricing is is that it 's a technology trial and a psychological trial for something called road pricing .']
hypothesis: Congestion pricing is a test of the technology behind road pricing and of people's psychology about it.

source: 情報も 情報へのアクセスも無料であるべきです そして二酸化炭素の排出に対して課金すべきです
references: ['Information should be free , and access to information should be free , and we should be charging people for carbon .']
hypothesis: Information, access to information should be free, and we should charge for carbon emissions.

source: しかし状況は変わりつつあり 近年 新しい中心人物達が 登場してきました
references: ['But the picture is changing , and we are seeing that there are new key players coming onto the scene .']
hypothesis: But things are changing, and in recent years new central figures have emerged.

source: なぜパラドックスかというと その前の10年は実りが多く それも一つの出来事が寄与しています
references: ['And the paradox is that the decade before the last decade was so promising — and for one reason primarily .']
hypothesis: Why it's a paradox?

source: これは絶対に理解しなければ ならないことだと思います テクノロジーとグローバル化によって 社会は民衆から変わっていくからです
references: ['It 's crucial to understand , I believe , because of technology and because of globalization , societies from bottom-up .']
hypothesis: I think this is something we absolutely have to understand, because technology and globalization are changing society from the people.

source: ただ この10年間 こうした手法を 恐れて使用しなかっただけなのです
references: ['But the problem is that we are coming out of a decade where we had a fear of touching it .']
hypothesis: It's just that we've been afraid to use these techniques for the last 10 years.

source: 建築や設計に関する 知識のない 住人たち自身により 独特のやり方で設計された エレベーターのない 45階建のビルです
references: ['Designed in very specific ways by this group of people who haven 't had any education in architecture or design .']
hypothesis: It's a 45-story, elevator-less building that was uniquely designed by its inhabitants, who had no knowledge of architecture or design.

source: ここの伝統では 花嫁になる女性が 花婿の男性のもとに持っていく 全ての持ちものを展示するのです
references: ['In this tradition , the bride-to-be displays all of their belongings , which they soon bring to their new husband .']
hypothesis: The tradition here is for the bride-to-be to display all that she would bring to the groom's man.

source: 空間もお金も限られている にもかかわらず この地域の家は 緻密に注意深く 設計 ・ 装飾されています
references: ['Despite having limited access to space and money , the homes in the area are designed with care and detail .']
hypothesis: Despite limited space and money, homes in this area are meticulously and carefully designed and decorated.

source: つまりコカコーラの マーケティングに頼っているのです ではコカコーラのマーケティングの秘訣は何でしょう ？
references: ['So , they rely on Coca-Cola in terms of its marketing , and what 's the secret to their marketing ?']
hypothesis: So we rely on Coca-Cola marketing. So what's the secret to Coca-Cola marketing?

source: これが全部一緒に実施されたらどうなるかについて話しましょう この3つのことを連動させるとどうなるかです
references: ['So let 's talk about what happens when this all comes together , when you tie the three things together .']
hypothesis: Let's talk about what happens when all this is done together, what happens when you put these three things together.

source: 1988年を振り返ってみると 世界中で約35万人の ポリオ患者がいました
references: ['So if you look back to 1988 , there are about 350,000 cases of polio on the planet that year .']
hypothesis: If you look back to 1988, there were about 350,000 polio cases worldwide.

source: 障害者のための車椅子iBOTに この技術を適用したときには 技術が中心的でした
references: ['It really was a big idea in technology when we started applying it in the iBOT for the disabled community .']
hypothesis: Technology was central when we applied this technology to a wheelchair iBOT for people with disabilities.

source: 我々は交通に関する問題を 全て解決し 世界を変え 今のこの世界にいます
references: ['We 've solved all the transportation problems that have changed the world to get it to where we are today .']
hypothesis: We have solved all transportation problems, changed the world, and we are in this world now.

source: 150年前 蒸気機関車が十分効率的になり 大陸が国家に変わりました
references: ['150 years ago , locomotives got efficient enough , steam power , that we turned the continent into a country .']
hypothesis: 150 years ago, steam locomotives became efficient enough to turn continents into nations.

source: しかし 実際は最後の１マイルが 問題として残っています 現在 全人口の半分は 密度の高い都市に住み
references: ['The fact is , the last mile is the problem , and half the world now lives in dense cities .']
hypothesis: But the reality is that the last mile remains a problem, and now half of all people live in dense cities.

source: この国で こんなエネルギーで水を きれいにするのは合理的ではありません この国で こんなエネルギーで水を きれいにするのは合理的ではありません
references: ['That 's so much energy , you couldn 't afford to desalinate or clean water in this country that way .']
hypothesis: It's not rational to use this kind of energy to clean water in this country It's not rational to use this kind of energy to clean water in this country

source: そして 女性に水を探すために ４時間もかけさせたり 子供が死ぬのを見せてはいけません
references: ['And women shouldn 't have to spend four hours a day looking for it , or watching their kids die .']
hypothesis: And don't make a woman spend four hours looking for water or watch a child die.

source: さらに言えば アインシュタインは 重力は世界のあらゆるものが 相関性を持つから存在すると説きました
references: ['Now , not only that , but Einstein taught us that gravity is the result of the world being relational .']
hypothesis: What's more, Einstein said that gravity exists because everything in the world is related.

source: 42番街から47番街までの ブロードウェイを閉鎖して 約１万平方メートルの 歩行者天国を作ったのです 約１万平方メートルの 歩行者天国を作ったのです
references: ['We closed Broadway from 42nd Street to 47th Street and created two and a half acres of new pedestrian space .']
hypothesis: We closed Broadway from 42nd Street to 47th Street and created a 10,000-square-foot pedestrian mall.

source: つまり 太陽系で 生命が宿れる環境かもしれないということです
references: ['So what we 're saying , essentially , is maybe that 's a habitat for life in the solar system .']
hypothesis: That means it could be a habitable environment for life in our solar system.

source: これも氷が噴出している本物の写真です 息をのむ美しさですが
references: ['And so this , again , a real picture of the ice fountains rising up into space , absolutely beautiful .']
hypothesis: This is also a real picture of ice erupting, and it's breathtaking.

source: 私たちがつくった番組の中で 物理の法則は普遍だと強調し続けました
references: ['In " " Wonders of the Solar System , " " we kept emphasizing the laws of physics are universal .']
